ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Thoughts read: Some people believe that their thoughts can be read. Have other people ever read your thoughts?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Special messages: Have you ever believed that you were being sent special messages through the television?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Spied upon: Have you ever thought that you were being followed or spied upon?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Heard voices: Have you ever heard voices that other people could not hear?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Controlled: Have you ever felt that you were under the control of some special power?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Reads minds: Have you ever known what another person was thinking even though that person was not speaking?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Body changed: Have you ever felt as though your body had been changed in some way that you could not understand?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Special powers: Do you have any special powers that other people do not have?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Seen things: Have you ever seen something or someone that other people could not see?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: Bizarre: Have you ever seriously worried that your child was thinking or acting in a bizarre way?
Notes: 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat true; 2= Certainly true

ElementDescription: PLEQ-C Self-Report - High Response Threshold Dichotomous Total Score
Notes: Sum of pleq_c1-9, dichotomously coded as 0= Not or somewhat true; 1= Certainly true

ElementDescription: PLEQ-C Caregiver Report - Low Response Threshold Dichotomous Total Score
Notes: Sum of pleq_c1-10, dichotomously coded as 0= Not true; 1= Somewhat or certainly true
